content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

df = DataFrame(dt=["2019-01-01","2019-02-01"])
df[!, :ym] = add_yearmonth(df.dt)

function add_yearmonth(dt::Vector{Date})
    ym = []
    for i in eachindex(dt)
        push!(ym, string(YearMonth(dt[i]).value))
    end
    return ym
end
```

This will create a new column `ym` in the DataFrame `df`, where each element is a string representing the year and month of the corresponding date in `dt`. The function uses the `YearMonth` type from the Dates module to extract the year and month from each date, and then concatenates them together as an integer in format "yyyymm".
